thread.section_title: National News -  New York Daily News
thread.title: Suicidal woman charged after cop trying to save her dies in river
thread.title_full: Suicidal woman charged after cop trying to save her dies in river

author: CHRISTOPHER BRENNAN
title: Suicidal woman charged after cop trying to save her dies in river
text:
Suicidal Nashville woman faces homicide charge after cop dies in river trying to save her Suicidal woman charged after cop trying to save her dies in river Nashville Police Officer Eric Mumaw, 44, died Thursday after falling into the Cumberland River. (Nashville Police Department) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated:   5:26 PM 
A suicidal Nashville woman faces a homicide charge after a Nashville cop died while trying to save her from driving into a river. 
Juli Glisson had parked her car on a boat ramp along the Cumberland River around 4:15 a.m. Thursday morning when officers tried to save her, police said. 
Eric Mumaw and a fellow officer had been at the driver’s side window trying to convince the 40-year-old woman to come to safety, but both fell into the cold water along with the car when Glisson allegedly put the vehicle in drive and it lurched forward. 
The Nashville Police said the vehicle continued pulling Mumaw, 44, into the water, and the officer could not hold onto him as he drifted away. Juli Glisson, 40, is charged with aggravated vehicular homicide after allegedly putting her parked car into drive. (Metropolitan Nashville PD) 
Temperatures in Nashville were in the high 30s, according to National Weather Service data, with strong currents reported in the Cumberland. 
Investigators believe that Glisson, who was allegedly threatening to kill herself, was able to swim from her car to the riverbank, and she remained hospitalized as of Friday afternoon. 
The fallen officer’s body was found in the river several hours later. Emergency workers search for Mumaw in the Cumberland River on Thursday. (AP) 
Glisson was legally drunk behind the wheel, according to police, who said they would arrest her for the homicide charge when she is discharged from medical care. 
Skeletal remains found in Tenn. identified as missing soldier 
She was on probation for a drunk driving arrest last April. 
Memorial services will be held for Mumaw, who previously received a “Lifesaving Award” for saving a sword attack victim, on Monday. 
A Change.org petition has also called for the riverside park where the incident happened to be renamed Mumaw Park. Join the Conversation:
